channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Don’t sell just because there’s a bubble,’ says Ray Dalio, but be prepared for low returns over be next 10 years
item.description: "I think the picture is pretty clear in that we are in that territory of a bubble, but we don't have the pricking of the bubble yet," Dalio said.

item.title: Mamdani at the White House, and the Coast Guard’s New Policy on Swastikas and Nooses
The IPO market is being re-globalized as Asia’s markets embrace dual listings and corporate governance reform
item.description: Asian companies are increasingly exploring the possibility of listing in non-U.S. markets.

item.title: Anxiety Over A.I. Spending Returns to Global Markets
item.description: A sharp reversal in Asian and European stocks, after a rally fueled by Nvidia’s strong earnings, underscores how fears of an A.I. bubble are driving b...

item.title: Sam Altman’s eye-scanning orb startup says employees should only care about work—for the good of humanity—otherwise ‘you should just not be here’
item.description: “We work weekends, we're always on call, and we push as hard as our circumstances allow us to,” Tools for Humanity CEO Alex Blania said in a January s...

item.title: Japan’s Leader Gets Off to Rocky Start With China
item.description: Facing reprisals from Beijing for a remark over Taiwan, Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi must walk a fine line to prevent escalating the dispute without ...

item.title: Skims founding partner Emma Grede schedules an ‘AI day’ once every six weeks to future-proof her career: ‘It’s like do or die’
item.description: Upskilling in AI is unavoidable as workers look to ‘future-proof our organizations and ourselves,’ Grede added.

item.title: USA Rare Earth CEO describes ‘Manhattan Project’ to wean U.S. from dependence on China
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Republicans’ Redistricting Push Is at Risk of Backfiring
item.description: A series of setbacks for the G.O.P. leaves an unlikely opening for Democrats to narrowly win this year’s redistricting wars.

item.title: After Syria’s 14-Year Civil War, a Search for Victims Leads to Mass Graves

item.title: Fine Chocolate in Brazil, Home of the Cacao Bean
item.description: A new generation of craft chocolatiers in Brazil is making bars with “identity.” They’re helping to sustain the forest, too.

item.title: Sanna Marin Led Finland Through Covid and Russian Threats. But She’s Famous for a Shimmy.
